FuncDef:
The mode channel network-header-length adjustment enable command configure the precision compensation function on channelized sub-interfaces.
The undo mode channel network-header-length adjustment enable command delete the precision compensation function on channelized sub-interfaces.
By default, the precision compensation function is not enabled on channelized sub-interfaces.
CLIs: undo mode channel network-header-length <network-header-length-value> adjustment enable

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a precision compensation value.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 63, in bytes.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The length of user packets varies according to the processing of the scheduling module, which affects the accuracy of traffic shaping. You can run the mode channel network-header-length adjustment enable command to adjust the precision compensation value. After this command is run on an interface, the device compensates the length of the packet of the channelized sub-interface on the interface, that is, the device compensates the length of the packet that passes through the channelized sub-interface.
Precautions
This command can be configured only on main interfaces that support channelized sub-interfaces.
If the qos default service-template command is run in the interface view to reference a service profile with a precision compensation value, and the mode channel network-header-length adjustment enable command is run to enable precision compensation for the interface with a specific precision compensation value, the precision compensation value configured in the mode channel network-header-length adjustment enable command takes precedence over the precision compensation value configured in the qos default service-template.
